H0.text: Using coal to generate electricity is an example of rethinking an existing idea in science when new discoveries alter existing information.

H1.text: Discovering a new species of snake is the most likely example of a rethinking of an existing idea in science, where new discoveries alter previously accepted information.

H2.text: Developing an antibiotic to treat infections is the most likely example of a rethinking of an existing idea when new discoveries alter existing information in science.

H3.text: Changing the definition of the term planet is an example of rethinking an existing idea in science, where old ideas can be altered by new discoveries that change existing information.

A4.text: The discovery of Eris forced the IAU to act on a definition.

A5.text: Mike Brown of the California Institute of Technology suggested that a 'planet' should be redefined as 'any body in the Solar System that is more massive than the total mass of all of the other bodies in a similar orbit.'
